text:
Autodesk serves three
markets: AEC, manufacturing
and media and entertainment.

In each of these areas, we
saw a cloud opportunity.

An opportunity to bring our
customer's data into a cloud
environment and build additional
technologies on top of them

that help them build
and complete workflows.

We were faced with having to
look at many cloud providers,
and each development team was looking at
what would be the right cloud provider
and right tool for them.
This created a fragmented space

where different teams were
writing services that needed
to talk, oftentimes across providers.

It made our surface area
for security much broader.
It made our ability

to optimize our solutions
almost impossible.
And so we decided that we would
go all in on AWS

and it has provided a
ton of benefit for

the speed in which we
can deliver software.
AWS provides us the ability
to deploy our systems globally.

We need to build our
models that are based on
what our customers are doing.
These are complex design models
that need to be trained on,
and we've been able to use SageMaker

to help build our own custom
models that has allowed us
to accelerate Autodesk AI.

Moving to an AWS platform
enabled us to focus our energy

and make a couple of
decisions for our developers.
They no longer had to choose which cloud
provider they would select.

They didn't have to evaluate
the security profiles,
they didn't have to reevaluate the uptime,
the regions that they're deployed into.
Building on AWS allows us
to go faster and be more secure
and provide more value to our customers.
